name: treatment, sludge from pulp and paper production, landfarming | organo-mineral phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23166/documentation

This dataset represents the service of the spreading of sludge from pulp and paper production on agricultural fields. The sludge is a mix of sludge from primary and secondary wastewater treatment and from a deinking process. The reference flow is one kg of pulp and paper sludge (wet mass) loaded from storage unit at the farm, transported to farmlands and spread as organic fertilisers with solid manure spreader. It is assumed the sludge is applied to maize cropland (25%), soybeans (35%) and cultivated grassland (40%). The dataset is heavily parameterized and could be used as a template for sludges with other compositions insofar as sludge composition is changed in the reference flow exchange properties and the plausibility of values for context-specific parameters (e.g. ammonia emissions) are checked.

From sludge loading into solid manure spreader with hydraulic loader at farm.

This activity ends with pulp and paper sludge application on farmlands. The dataset includes loading from storage unit at farm, on-farm transportation and application of 1 kg of sludge on farmland. The land surface on which 1 kg of sludge is applied was calculated to be 5.5E-5 ha, given the amount of nutrients contained in the sludge, the fertilising needs of the crops and the crop distribution that receives this sludge in Quebec (Canada). The inventory takes into account the emissions related to sludge application with machinery. For the sludge emission inventory, the emissions of various substances and compounds (N, P, K, metals, dioxins/furanes) are taken into account. Metals are considered to be entirely emitted in the agricultural soil. Emitted metal speciations remain unknown. The inventory also takes into account the liming effect (CaCO3-eq) of the sludge. The dataset does not include: sludge storage at farm or in field and any related emissions, and emissions of P into groundwater.

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The Quebec dataset has been extrapolated to the GLO geography. Data quality indicators have been adjusted accordingly.

Calculations of N2O emissions are based on the IPCC method. The indirect emission factors are taken from IPCC and the direct emission factors are canadian-specific. Calculations of NOx emissions are based on an expert judment and considered to be fit for the Quebec context. Calculations of NH3 and NO3 emissions are based on Swiss models used with parameters from the Quebec context. Calculations of P and PO4 emissions are from a Quebec-specific model. Since models are usually based on solid animal manure, solid pulp and paper sludge are deemed to be an equivalent organic fertiliser.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data mainly originate from acknowledged model, scientific literature, government publications and handbook. Some specific data come from expert judgement and a pulp mill. See sources.

exchanges.description: This is the total phosphate (as P2O5) output (organic and mineral forms of phosphate contained) from organic origin. In practice, only a part of this total amount is available to the plants and the available amount has to be calculated considering efficiency of organic phosphate (to replace mineral phosphate), which also depends on many factors, such as climate, soil, crop, timing and technique of application, etc. For information purposes, the amount considering efficiency of organic phosphate is estimated in the parameter section of this dataset under "phosphorus availability for plants". Since this dataset includes field emissions from the application of sludge, phosphate availability has been accounted for in the calculation of direct field emissions.
